gs1_sources.description: A globally unique identifier for trade items (products or services) that may be priced, ordered, or invoiced at any point in the supply chain.
gs1_sources.scope: Product identification for trade items at any packaging level (consumer unit, case, pallet)

gs1_sources.description: A globally unique identifier for parties (legal entities, functions) and locations (physical, operational) in the supply chain.
gs1_sources.scope: Identification of legal entities, trading parties, physical locations, and operational locations

gs1_sources.description: A network of interoperable data pools enabling trading partners to share trusted product master data in real-time.
gs1_sources.scope: Product master data synchronisation between trading partners via certified data pools

gs1_sources.full_name: Electronic Product Code Information Services / Core Business Vocabulary
gs1_sources.description: A traceability event messaging standard enabling supply chain visibility through sharing event data (what, where, when, why) using a common vocabulary.
gs1_sources.scope: Capture and share visibility events across supply chain (ObjectEvent, AggregationEvent, TransactionEvent, TransformationEvent)

gs1_sources.description: A standardised method for encoding GS1 identifiers (GTINs, GLNs, SSCCs) in web URIs, enabling QR codes and barcodes to link to web resources.
gs1_sources.scope: Web-enabling GS1 identifiers through standardised URI syntax for linking physical products to digital information

gs1_sources.description: A globally unique identifier for logistic units (pallets, cases, containers) enabling tracking of shipments through the supply chain.
gs1_sources.scope: Identification of logistic units for tracking shipments and enabling supply chain visibility

metadata.purpose: Authoritative GS1 source metadata for EU_ESG_to_GS1_Mapping v1.1 artefact set
